Monument Info
Stonehenge is more than the ring of stones which you see, the whole landscape of Amesbury was used in ritual practices. The stonehenge monoliths were constructed around 3100BC.
The earliest Egyptian pyramids construction began around 2630BC. The were mostly used as tombs for the Pharaohs and the upper class.
Petra is an ancient city in Jordan, construction is thought to have begun in the 5th c. BC. This particular building is known as the Treasury, an elaborate temple.
The Colosseum is the largest amphitheatre ever built, it could hold 50 to 80,000 people, where gladiator battles, dramas and executions could be witnessed.
Hagia Sophia or "Holy Wisdom" has had many uses in its history in Istanbul, switching from a Christian Church to a Greek Orthodox Church to a Mosque and now it is a museum.
Angkor Wat is the largest religious monument in the world built in Cambodia. It appears on the countrys flag and is a major attraction to tourists.
Moai are the Easter Island monuments tht the world over are fascinated by. The tallest was almost 10m tall and there are more than 900 of them.
Machu Picchu is an Incan citadel thought to have been built as an estate for one of the Emperors. It is 7970ft above sea level and many tourists follow the Incan trail to reach the Lost City.
Taj Mahal was built as a mausoleum for emperor Shah Jahan\'s favourite wife in 1632. It is often claimed as the ultimate symbol of love and devotion.
Eiffel Tower is named after its engineer Gustave Eiffel, built as an entrance to 1889 World Fair. Conspiracy theorists believe it to be a part of a massive satellite dish.
